intro: Chloraea densipapillosa, commonly known as the dense papillate chloraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest margins, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are densely covered with fine, papillate (bump-like) structures, giving it a unique texture. The flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, are clustered in inflorescences and attract various pollinators.
